page.title: 11HERTSMERE'S COAT-OF-ARMS
page.content: Granted in 1975, Hertsmere's coat-of- arms reflects the diversity of the Borough. On the shield the hart of Hertfordshire surmounts a battlemented wall with a raised portcullis denoting the open gateway to London, but also reminding of a commitment to the protection of local amenities. Above the civic helmet is the crest of another hart resting its hoof on a reel of cine-film (for the Borehamwood studios): behind is an oak tree for Tidwulf's tree (the origin of Elstree). The shield's supporters are also harts, but each is emblazoned on the shoulder with (left) an artist's palette for Bushey to the west, and (right) with a potter's wheel for Potters Bar in the east. The motto is taken from that of the former Elstree Rural District Council - "Do Well and Fear Not".
